name: Melia Lima

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night before our Cuzco trip and two nights after. The 1st stay, we were offered and took an upgrade from our Junior Deluxe Suite to the Junior Deluxe Room (Level Floors) for $30 (which included internet in the room, cocktail hour & breakfast). Considering breakfast was $13 @ and internet was $12, it made sense for us to do it.
reviews.title: Acceptable hotel but there are probably better options out there

reviews.text: The room was on the 12th floor and was not that big but was at least updated. Cocktail hour was actually good as they can make drinks for you for no extra cost and there are lots of available hors d'oeuvres. However, breakfast was bland and not really up to par.
reviews.title: Great hotel from service to food to accomodating staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the 2nd stay, we decided not to spend $30/night on the upgrade as we really did not want to eat breakfast there again. The room we booked was again a Junior Deluxe Suite, but since it was not on the Level floors, it was not updated. The furniture looked like it was straight out of the early 80s; however, the room was huge! It must have been double the size of our Level floor room.
reviews.title: In the middle of nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in an upper-class neighborhood so it's very safe, but there is nothing really around to walk to. We did discover that it is only a few blocks from the nice Miraflores area (near the casinos and nicer hotels), and it is an easy walk there.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel and would return

reviews.text: Service was good, especially the bellboy and valet. The front desk, however, didn't seem too knowledgeable about the rewards program. I wanted to make sure my stay was credited to my member # but I did not have it with me. I asked to search it by name and they said they didn't have the ability to do that but that I could call the 800# to request it. I found this quite inconvenient as I didn't want to pay for a phone call from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great location and kind staff

reviews.text: Nice, pretty, quite well located hotel. In general, very good impression.
reviews.title: Nice hotel to stay

reviews.text: This was one of the best places I've ever stayed. The staff was awesome, helping us with everything we needed. Dinner was fantastic with a great array of food. The room was huge and cozy, and with a really nice bathroom. I simply have no complaints about it. It was fantastic.
reviews.title: Such a great place. Wish I had stayed longer.

reviews.text: LOCATION: The hotel is in a corner between two very busy streets, which is probably bad for noise-sensitive people. Location was good for doing business, but it was far from the beach and Miraflores where most of the good restaurants are (I tried "Brujas de Cachiche" which was fantastic!). Yes, you can go back and forth with a taxi, but I would avoid if if on holidays. The hotel is right in front of a pharmacy, two supermarkets and several small restaurants and shops. It is also close to one of the big shopping malls in Lima.
reviews.title: Good for business, but not close to Miraflores

reviews.text: THE HOTEL: It felt safe and all staff were very friendly. The hotel doesn't feel tired, but it is not newly refurbished either. My company used the conference center and service given was very good. Perhaps one of the big pluses is that you can hire a car to take you back and forth to the airport: service was always on time, they had brand new and spacious cars, and driver drove decently for the Lima standards.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in Lima

reviews.text: THE ROOM: Yes, it was noisy, but clean, spacious and perfectly adequate for my business needs. I had a large TV with cable, a safe and coffee maker. The bathroom was full of marble everywhere. A very important plus as a business traveler is that I got free Internet!
reviews.title: Great for the $$

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there a couple nights as part of a tour. It met all our expectations, not super fancy but nice clean rooms, comfy beds and all the basic amenities. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Exchange rates at the front desk were a bit less favorable than the airport but the convenience made up for any minor difference. Great breakfast buffet and the restaurant was also good for lunch and dinner.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - reasonable location
Will not honor your reservation
reviews.text: The hotel is a bit out of the way to try and walk to much of the touristy type stuff but it's not too long a cab ride to the beach, shopping, great restaurants, etc. Hotel staff will get you a taxi no problem and confirm rates (we were warned against just flagging cabs off the street since many are unlicensed and uncontrolled).
After a very long flight I made it to the Melia Hotel only to find out I had no room.
reviews.title: Great quality, both in room and service

reviews.text: I was told some people staying there had a flight canceled so they were staying longer.
reviews.title: Super love it!

reviews.text: I made my reservation 4 weeks in advance. They changed my reservation to a different
reviews.title: 5 star treatment, excellent beds, highly recommended

reviews.text: The location is not ideal for sightseeing but it is quiet. I loved the breakfast buffet which had lots of Peruvian dishes to choose from. Staff was polite and very helpful even when I called numerous times at 4 am because of a failing Internet connection. Would go there again.
reviews.title: a bit out of the way but good service

reviews.text: Decent hotel but little less then what I expected.
reviews.title: Correct hotel - good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms could use a bit more modern furniture and some more power plugs without having to move that same heavy wooden 70´s furniture.
reviews.title: Very Average Hotel

reviews.text: Restaurant is OK but 2 first wines I choose from the menu where not available. Maybe then it would be better to change the menu ...
reviews.title: Very good ratio quality/price

reviews.text: Friendly staff and good service.
reviews.title: Nice smelling room.

description: The Meliá Lima is located in the residential & financial area of San Isidro. It is the 5* Hotel closest to the International Airport "Jorge Chávez". The International Pacific Exhibition Center, the historical center of Lima and the commercial & leisure district of Miraflores are close by.
